title.narrative: 002 EVERY CHILD ACCESSING LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES

description.narrative: By 2025, out of school girls and boys, with a focus on the most disadvantaged and those affected by humanitarian situations access education and skills development programmes., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 'By 2025, girls and boys in Ethiopia, in particular the most disadvantaged and those affected by humanitarian situations, benefit from an equitable and resilient education system enabling them to acquire relevant knowledge and skills.

participating-org.narrative: B GUMUZ REGIONAL EDUCATION BUREAU REB

mailing-address.narrative: UNICEF House (Kazanchis - Opposite UNECA/German House) P.O. Box 1169 Addis Ababa

sector.narrative: Provision of (formal and non-formal) multiple-levels or alternative pathways of education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of skills development (including in temporary learning spaces)
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2025, out of school girls and boys, with a focus on the most disadvantaged and those affected by humanitarian situations accesseducation and skills development programmes.

description.narrative: UNICEF provided EiE assistance for 379,882 (43% girls) children to access learning opportunities, including 42,552 (49% girls) in pre-primary; 135,135 (48% girls) in primary, including 69,928 displaced (47% girls) and 202,195 (37% girls) from refugee/host communities. This includes over 31,000 children (49% girls) reached through integrated education and child protection services (“My Home”) in Afar, Amhara, Benishangul-Gumuz, Oromia, SNNPR, Tigray, partnered with CSOs and REBs.;UNICEF supported technically the revision of MoE’s safe school reopening guidelines and communication strategy, and REBs to adapt the plans, organize community consultations, and conduct back- to-school campaigns. Funding gap for EiE response was 47%. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:08/01/2022
